answers.answer: It usually means your sugar level is elevated which means there is a chance you have it. Did you fast before you went? If not your supposed too. I had it with my first pregnancy
Sometimes women need more then an hour to regulate the sugar. With my doctor they did a 2 hour test instead of one hour.
Also some who failed the first usually pass the 3 hour.

it is possible for it to be abnormal during the 1 hr test and not during the 3 hr test. my step sister failed the one hr test with her last pregnancy and passed the 3 hr test just fine. make sure you fast and nothing to eat or drink past midnight except water if needed.

I didn't intentionally fast before it because I was told I didn't have to, but I think I had like one bite of yogurt before.  This one they said fast for 12 hours prior...I'm just nervous. Is it something you just manage with a good diet? I'm glad there's still a chance to have normal results. I go in tomorrow morning.
I failed mine too,and this is my 3rd baby never had this problem before. I go friday for my 3hr one.
That happened to me nd i ended up not having it

Yes just eating healthy and no processed foods. You just look at the sugars on any label. I found it as a blessing in disguise because I didn't gain alot of weight when I started watching what I was eating.
I hope i dont have it,ive been very careful w what i eat so i wouldn't gain as much like the dr said,he was shocked w the results too. Hoping for a better out come especially w only 8 weeks to go.

question: Abnormal. I went in last week to do the one hour test, the Dr called this morning & said the results were abnormal so I need to go in asap to do the 3 hour one. Does this mean it's likely that I do have it? & what exactly would that mean? Has this happend to anyone & it turned out they DIDN'T have it?
title: gestational diabetes result
